Description: Round-topped limestone stela with painted detail divided into three registers: 1 - Scene of Osiris enthroned before an offering-table and the adoring figures of the deceased and his parents; wedjat-eyes above. 2 - Scene of a central figure with a libation-jar flanked on each side by an offering-table and a seated couple. 3 - Four kneeling figures and an offering-table. Some Hieroglyphic text remains but all personal names have been erased.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1925 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 7. (pl.48)
